instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  - backlight repair
threads.message:
Hi,

MBP13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) had burned LCD connector (PIN21/22 backlight burned ) and blown fuse F9800. Replaced LCD connector, LVDS Cable (was also burned on backlight PINs) and F9800. After replacing fuse tested with multimeter and found no shorts in backlight driver and backlight support area. Before attaching screen measured 37-38V on LVDS connector backlight pins. When I attached screen, backlight went on for about 5 seconds and turned off. Measured backlight again for longer on PIN21/PIN22 of LVDS and still got 38V peak, but voltage is not stable and goes down to 6V and then up again. F9800 is not blown and voltage on fuse is 10.7V (should be 12.6V according to schematics). Any ideas what could be broken, should be replaced next?

Thx.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  - backlight repair
threads.message: Are you measuring the 10.7V when on battery power? 12.6V is only present when battery is charged and AC is connected.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  - backlight repair
threads.message: I measured with AC connected, but battery disconnected.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  - backlight repair
threads.message: Check again because F9800 should be directly connected to PPBUS. PPBUS without battery connected should be 12.56V.
